poem:
Title: Upon the Dawn of Digitized Truth

Russet morn, heavy as silicon with uncertainties,
greets the assembled cast, ready for linguistic diversities.
Twenty-four tongues now the currency of truth,
scuttling through wires to uncrown each political ruse.
To yoke the tides of falsity, echoes of the DSA,
Their ranks arise, a crusade in click-bait disarray,
Fearing not the shadows, nor the byte-twisted night,
Their searchlight hearts seeking only pixels of right.
